fullDescription.intro: This node can visualize a graph with different layouts. The node table in port 1 must contain node IDs and the edge table in port 2 must contain source and target node IDs. Any data in the node or edge table can be used for highlighting (as explained below).

tab.name: Input
tab.option: Node table column containing the node IDs.
Edge table column containing the node IDs of the source nodes.
Edge table column containing the node IDs of the target nodes.
When checked a svg graphic instead of a png is put in the ouput port.

tab.name: Options Bar
tab.option: Current editing mode. If "Transforming" is selected the user can move the graph by using the mouse. In "Picking" mode the user can select and unselect nodes and edges.
If checked, edges with the same source and target are joined.
If checked, nodes without any connected edges are not shown.
Layout to visualize the graph.
Diameter of the nodes.

tab.name: Context Menu
tab.option: Resets translation and scale to default.
The image as can be saved as a PNG- or SVG-file.
Shows the properties of all selected nodes.
Clears node selection.
Selects all edges, whose source and target nodes are already selected.
Opens a dialog to help the user highlight all selected nodes.

option.name: Node Selection -> Collapse To Meta Node

tab.option: Collapses all selected nodes into one new Meta Node.

option.name: Node Selection -> Expand From Meta Node

tab.option: Expands each selected Meta Node to its original nodes.
Shows the properties of all selected edges.
Clears edge selection.
Opens a dialog to help the user highlight all selected edges.
Opens a dialog to add, remove and edit Highlight Conditions for nodes.
Removes all Highlight Conditions for nodes.
All nodes that have non zero values for the specified Highlight Condition will be selected.
Opens a dialog to add, remove and edit Highlight Conditions for edges.
Removes all Highlight Conditions for edges.
All edge that have non zero values for the specified Highlight Condition will be selected.

tab.name: Highlight Condition Dialog
tab.option: Type of the condition. A logical condition is an And/Or conjunction of logical expressions like "City == Berlin" or "Inhabitants > 10". It can only be true or false. In the "Logical Condition"-section it is shown how to create a logical condition. A value condition uses numerical properties, for example "Log value of Inhabitants". In the "Value Condition"-section it is shown how to create a value condition. A logical value condition is a value condition that is only applied to elements, for which the logical condition is true.

Color of the highlighted elements. For a logical conditions all true elements are painted. For a value condition all elements with values > 0 are painted (the higher the value the higher alpha value used for painting).
Property, that should be used as a label for all painted elements.

tab.name: Logical Condition
tab.option: When a logical conditions consists of multiple expressions, And/Or conjunctions between these expressions must be specified. "And"-conjunctions will be evaluated before "Or"-conjunctions.
Property of the logical expression. Is compared to "Value".
Type of the logical expression.
Value of the logical expression. Is compared to "Property".

tab.name: Value Condition
tab.option: Property of the value condition.
Type of the value condition. If "Log Value" is used, the logarithmic function with base 10 is applied to all property values, before visualizing. For "Value" no function is applied.
